page.title: 05GROWTH OF WEST HAGLEY
page.content: The Kidderminster road from the Lyttelton Arms was very narrow and twisting, with high hedges. There was no main road at this time linking Stourbridge to W. Hagley.{Middlefield{ {Lane}began at the forge. The main road to Kidderminster was diverted to its present course in 1922,and Middlefield lost part of its length. In 1852, the{railway}was completed- the station was built by 1884. A mile away from the old village, it lead to a new community developing at W.Hagley By the turn of the century, it was realised that a second church was needed, and between 1900 and 1908 money was raised to build{St.Saviour's In 1930, the Free Church was built. An{infant school}used to exist in Bromsgrove Road, and a senior school, built by the Lytteltons in 1827. The 3 main schools are now in W.Hagley.
